node.title: New Caledonia votes 'no' to independence for third time
node.description: With all ballots counted, 96.49 per cent were against independence, while only 3.51 per cent were in favour, from a turn-out of 43.90 per cent, according to New Caledonia's high commission.
node.content:
["New Caledonians\u00a0have voted overwhelmingly to remain part of France in a third referendum that was boycotted by pro-independence groups, raising fears of new tensions.", "With all ballots counted on Sunday, 96.49 per cent were against independence, while only 3.51 per cent were in favour, with turn-out a mere 43.90 per cent, according to the islands' high commission.", "The indigenous Kanak population, who largely favour independence, had called for non-participation in the referendum because they are in a 12-month mourning period following a September surge in coronavirus infections.", "Observers say the result could exacerbate ethnic tensions, with the poorer indigenous Kanak community generally favouring independence over the wealthier white community.", "Police reinforcements have been sent to the territory\u00a0which is of strategic importance to France and part of a wider tussle for influence in the Pacific between Western countries and China.", "The boycott and crushing nature of the 'No'\u00a0vote will raise fears of protests as well as questions about the democratic legitimacy of the referendum on the archipelago, 1,500 kilometres\u00a0east of Brisbane.", "", "
President Macron admitted\u00a0that New Caledonia voters were \"profoundly divided\" over the referendum.(AFP: Ludovic MARIN)
", "French President Emmanuel Macron noted \"the high abstention rates\" but said France could be \"proud\" of a more than 30-year process designed to settle the islands' status under which residents were asked in three separate referendums if they wished to break away.", "Having rejected independence in 2018 and then again last year, inhabitants were called\u00a0to answer one last time whether they wanted New Caledonia \"to accede to full sovereignty and become independent\".", "Mr Macron said that \"a period of transition\" would begin for New Caledonia after voters overwhelmingly rejected independence, adding that \"France is more beautiful\" with the Pacific islands included.", "\"A period of transition is beginning. Free from the binary choice of 'Yes' or 'No', we must now build a common project, while recognising and respecting the dignity of everyone,\" Mr Macron said in a recorded message.", "He said that the country could be \"proud\" of the process designed to settle the status of the islands under which residents were asked in three separate referendums if they wished to break away from France.", "He made no direct mention of the boycott, but\u00a0admitted that voters were \"profoundly divided\" and\u00a0expressed condolences to \"all those who have lost a loved one\".", "AFP/Reuters"]
